result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert V Lowery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars or taverns.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with A.B. (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Mental Health assessment and follow through with recommendations. Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.   Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant, EAB.  No contact with the victim, RRS (person, property, residence or family). Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
